doc.field: John Millaire Collection on Julius Hemphill
John Millaire Collection on Julius Hemphill

John Millaire is a retired videographer based in St. Louis, Missouri. This collection consists of digital transfers of 10 video recordings by Millaire of performances by Julius Hemphill and the Black Artist Group (BAG) in the 1970s.

John Millaire is a retired videographer based in St. Louis, Missouri. This collection consists of digital transfers of 10 video recordings by Millaire of performances by Julius Hemphill and the Black Artist Group (BAG) in the 1970s.

This collection consists of digital transfers of 10 video recordings by John Millaire of performances by Julius Hemphill and the Black Artist Group (BAG) in the 1970s. Recordings include an African dance and musical performance with Hemphill on the flute and saxophone; various theatrical and musical performances; Julius Hunter, a St. Louis news anchor, delivering the news circa 1976; a children's performance; and an outdoor concert featuring different singers and musicians. All of the recordings are in black and white.
John Millaire is a retired videographer based in St. Louis, Missouri.
Donated by John Millaire in December 2018; the accession number associated with this gift is 2019.026.

Advance notice is required for the use of computer records. Original physical digital media is restricted. An access terminal for born-digital materials in the collection is available by appointment for reading room viewing and listening only. Researchers may view an item's original container and/or carrier, but the physical carriers themselves are not available for use because of preservation concerns.
